author: m.kalinin
content:
> `max_pow_block_num + slot` makes a lot of sense
> Shouldn't post-merge TIMESTAMP just return GENESIS_TIME + slot_number * 12?
Originally we were trying to be as much conservative as we can in terms of changes in EVM that are required by the merge. Since there is an option to embed eth1 block data into beacon block it makes sense to revisit concerns regarding EVM updates as well.

author: .vbuterin
content: hmm, I feel like there is a choice of which layer of abstraction you're importing. One option is to call process_block, but the other option is to call process_tx

author: .vbuterin
content: Or am I misunderstanding how the engine works?

author: m.kalinin
content: It currently processes the block as a whole, as if it would be a regular eth1 block w/o ethash data, this is why preserving eth1 block's format is the easiest path. We may pass timestamp, block number, block hash to `insertBlock` invocation, but that would require additional work done on the engine side.
